intro: Ophthalmophyllum friedrichiae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows up to 30 cm in height, with vibrant violet or pink petals that attract pollinators. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value has led to the development of numerous cultivars with varying flower colors and leaf patterns.
